parent.body:
The wings are fundamentally order and chaos, The right represents order, the left represents chaos.

However, axis allow for nuance.  Economically, I'm very, very conservative.  In terms of liberty, I'm very much libertarian.  But in terms of society?  I'm contemporary leaning progressive.  This on the axis of:

Authority: Libertarian vs Authoritarian  
Economy: Liberal vs Conservative  
Society: Progressive vs Traditional  

Of course, this is just one possible setup for the axis.  Another I've seen measures freedom instead of order vs chaos, so the arrangement is different.  But this set of axis is the one I understand - and if it's a one dimensional scale, it would suggest I'm centrist.  But anyone who knows me knows I lean right on the mono-axis scale.  It just doesn't provide enough context or detail to get a good idea for who a person is.

It's also a big factor in what led to the political parties, with one representing "left" and one representing "right".  If we had more detail on our politicians instead of just having an R or D, or an L or R, it might help people make more educated decisions than they do now.
parent.body_html:

However, axis allow for nuance. Economically, I'm very, very conservative. In terms of liberty, I'm very much libertarian. But in terms of society? I'm contemporary leaning progressive. This on the axis of:

Authority: Libertarian vs Authoritarian
Economy: Liberal vs Conservative
Society: Progressive vs Traditional

Of course, this is just one possible setup for the axis. Another I've seen measures freedom instead of order vs chaos, so the arrangement is different. But this set of axis is the one I understand - and if it's a one dimensional scale, it would suggest I'm centrist. But anyone who knows me knows I lean right on the mono-axis scale. It just doesn't provide enough context or detail to get a good idea for who a person is.

It's also a big factor in what led to the political parties, with one representing "left" and one representing "right". If we had more detail on our politicians instead of just having an R or D, or an L or R, it might help people make more educated decisions than they do now.

That's the main reason, but another important factor is probably just luck.

post.body:
A few days ago I made some posts about having trouble accomplishing anything. I think I figured out ADHD and Imposter Syndrome as issues, but have been missing the elephant in the room.

For about a decade now I've been experiencing this huge mental block that I think might actually be at the heart of why I can't get anything done. Since then I have been seriously lacking in any creative ability whatsoever, nothing just comes to me anymore like it used to. However, for some reason I have retained the desire to do my usual things, despite having lost the ability. So I resort to thinking too hard about how to do something, and it just doesn't work without getting into the flow of it. This always bothered me, because it made the experience much more frustrating, and the results were never great. It becomes even worse when I see others succeeding in exactly all the things I want to do, and so easily. I think what it all comes down to is that I have this mental block and they do not, so things still just come to them naturally.

This came on pretty much suddenly one day, which is why I don't agree with people who say it's depression. It also did not make me feel depressed at all, in fact sadness actually became *less* intense for me afterwards, probably due to the right side of my brain practically shutting off. The first sign of trouble was that everything seemed noticeably more bland and frustrating than before. I chalked it up to having a bad couple of days and figured things would return to normal, but as time went on this did not change. I did not notice this then, but looking back now this is also about the time that I became very bad at finishing anything properly, instead it always resulted in a huge mess of a project that was only half-finished. At around the same time, new ideas stopped popping into my head too, whereas before it was pretty much overflowing. I used to come up with so many bizarre stories and could not stop, and now I can't even if I try. Finally, I no longer had a "taste" in anything, that is making my creations attractive, enjoyable, and complete (for me more than anyone else), they're now just a forced together, unfinished, unattractive mess. I didn't have to think about stuff much before this, I just was able to do it like the others I've been talking about being so much better than me. And now I can't, I have to "force" it and that never works. My whole state of mind is completely different now. If it matters, I was going through puberty at the time this occurred.

I've heard stories of things like writers block before and this seems like it but on a massive scale with every kind of subject. It kills me in programming, storytelling, art, math, science, music, humor, wording things, Minecraft, even making posts on reddit/ruqqus! It's very frustrating and has been going on for about a decade now with no end in sight. I can live with it but I'd *really* prefer a solution if there is one because I am not someone who likes to be bored and doing nothing all the time. I remember what it's like to always be doing so many interesting things which is probably why I still want to despite now lacking the ability. Any ideas on what to do about this gigantic mental block?

It also did not make me feel depressed at all, in fact sadness actually became less intense for me afterwards, probably due to the right side of my brain practically shutting off. The first sign of trouble was that everything seemed noticeably more bland and frustrating than before. I chalked it up to having a bad couple of days and figured things would return to normal, but as time went on this did not change. I did not notice this then, but looking back now this is also about the time that I became very bad at finishing anything properly, instead it always resulted in a huge mess of a project that was only half-finished. At around the same time, new ideas stopped popping into my head too, whereas before it was pretty much overflowing. I used to come up with so many bizarre stories and could not stop, and now I can't even if I try. Finally, I no longer had a "taste" in anything, that is making my creations attractive, enjoyable, and complete (for me more than anyone else), they're now just a forced together, unfinished, unattractive mess. I didn't have to think about stuff much before this, I just was able to do it like the others I've been talking about being so much better than me. And now I can't, I have to "force" it and that never works. My whole state of mind is completely different now. If it matters, I was going through puberty at the time this occurred.

I've heard stories of things like writers block before and this seems like it but on a massive scale with every kind of subject. It kills me in programming, storytelling, art, math, science, music, humor, wording things, Minecraft, even making posts on reddit/ruqqus! It's very frustrating and has been going on for about a decade now with no end in sight. I can live with it but I'd really prefer a solution if there is one because I am not someone who likes to be bored and doing nothing all the time. I remember what it's like to always be doing so many interesting things which is probably why I still want to despite now lacking the ability. Any ideas on what to do about this gigantic mental block?

It kills me in programming, storytelling, art, math, science, music, humor, wording things, Minecraft, even making posts on reddit/ruqqus! It's very frustrating and has been going on for about a decade now with no end in sight. I can live with it but I'd *really* prefer a solution if there is one because I am not someone who likes to be bored and doing nothing all the time. I remember what it's like to always be doing so many interesting things which is probably why I still want to despite now lacking the ability. Any ideas on what to do about this gigantic mental block?
post.body_html:
A few days ago I made some posts about having trouble accomplishing anything. I think I figured out ADHD and Imposter Syndrome as issues, but have been missing the elephant in the room.

For about a decade now I've been experiencing this huge mental block that I think might actually be at the heart of why I can't get anything done. Since then I have been seriously lacking in any creative ability whatsoever, nothing just comes to me anymore like it used to. However, for some reason I have retained the desire to do my usual things, despite having lost the ability. So I resort to thinking too hard about how to do something, and it just doesn't work without getting into the flow of it. This always bothered me, because it made the experience much more frustrating, and the results were never great. It becomes even worse when I see others succeeding in exactly all the things I want to do, and so easily. I think what it all comes down to is that I have this mental block and they do not, so things still just come to them naturally.

This came on pretty much suddenly one day, which is why I don't agree with people who say it's depression. It also did not make me feel depressed at all, in fact sadness actually became less intense for me afterwards, probably due to the right side of my brain practically shutting off. The first sign of trouble was that everything seemed noticeably more bland and frustrating than before. I chalked it up to having a bad couple of days and figured things would return to normal, but as time went on this did not change. I did not notice this then, but looking back now this is also about the time that I became very bad at finishing anything properly, instead it always resulted in a huge mess of a project that was only half-finished. At around the same time, new ideas stopped popping into my head too, whereas before it was pretty much overflowing. I used to come up with so many bizarre stories and could not stop, and now I can't even if I try. Finally, I no longer had a "taste" in anything, that is making my creations attractive, enjoyable, and complete (for me more than anyone else), they're now just a forced together, unfinished, unattractive mess. I didn't have to think about stuff much before this, I just was able to do it like the others I've been talking about being so much better than me. And now I can't, I have to "force" it and that never works. My whole state of mind is completely different now. If it matters, I was going through puberty at the time this occurred.

I've heard stories of things like writers block before and this seems like it but on a massive scale with every kind of subject. It kills me in programming, storytelling, art, math, science, music, humor, wording things, Minecraft, even making posts on reddit/ruqqus! It's very frustrating and has been going on for about a decade now with no end in sight. I can live with it but I'd really prefer a solution if there is one because I am not someone who likes to be bored and doing nothing all the time. I remember what it's like to always be doing so many interesting things which is probably why I still want to despite now lacking the ability. Any ideas on what to do about this gigantic mental block?
post.title: Massive mental block?

post.body:
If you try making a reply to another comment, it won't show up on your profile or the thread. It can only be accessed by clicking the direct permalink of the comment it was replied to, and the reply comment has no permalink (it just reloads the current page).

Also, if you got a reply to one of your comments in your inbox, it will create a notification, but since it's broken it'll cause you to get a 500 error when trying to access the page.

This should be fixed soon. In the meantime, if you're wondering why your inbox is broken and why your comments are missing, this is why.

Edit: this is now fixed!

post.body:
At 16:09 EDT on 04 Sep 2020 (about 26 hours ago), SalesForce (the owner of web hosting company Heroku) notified us that they had suspended the Ruqqus live and test server environments, with account termination to follow twenty-four hours later.

At the time of this writing, we have not been given a reason as to why we were being kicked. I do not believe we violated Heroku ToS (though Heroku may think otherwise) and we did not exceed Heroku usage limits. Our account manager was friendly but was unfortunately unable to provide us with any information. It is my opinion that by not warning us first (ex. "please remove X which violates Heroku's acceptable use policy") that Heroku actually violated their own terms of service.

We immediately downloaded all of the Ruqqus data, and began working on setting up shop at another host. 

I'd like to give a massive shoutout to @p2hang for lending his considerable expertise in support of getting Ruqqus operational as quickly as possible. He is the third recipient of the super-rare Fire Extinguisher badge.

All (or at least, almost all) functionality is restored. There are a few things which aren't quite yet back to normal, which I hope to fix over the course of tonight and tomorrow.

Known issues:

* ~~hCaptcha verification issues on attempted signups~~

* ~~Custom guild colors are currently disabled. This was an intentional decision by me, as there were issues loading the style files needed for custom coloring, so it was easier to just disable that for the sake of getting up and running.~~

* ~~Notification bell stuck on.~~

* ~~Lastly, and most importantly, we have no idea how well the current server will be able to handle user load. For that reason, I will be continuing to monitor and make adjustments as needed. Performance may be spotty and unreliable as load resumes.~~ ~~Doesn't seem to be an issue, but we'll have to see how it goes with everyone trying to get on.~~ There are some load/efficiency problems that I'm trying to sort out.

* ~~hCaptcha on signup is malfunctioning.~~

* ~~i.ruqqus.com image uploads don't save.~~

* The most recent 30k or so comments didn't make it into the new host. Also possibly some post votes. I *think* all the comment votes made it in. The missing data is something I'm still working on, but you will probably see rep fluctuating unpredictably as vanished stuff is no longer counted.

---

If you'd like to contribute to the future of freedom, please consider donating via [Patreon](https://patreon.com/ruqqus) or [Paypal](https://paypal.me/ruqqus) to help cover current and future server costs. [Cryptocurrency is also accepted](/help/donate).
post.body_html:
At 16:09 EDT on 04 Sep 2020 (about 26 hours ago), SalesForce (the owner of web hosting company Heroku) notified us that they had suspended the Ruqqus live and test server environments, with account termination to follow twenty-four hours later.

At the time of this writing, we have not been given a reason as to why we were being kicked. I do not believe we violated Heroku ToS (though Heroku may think otherwise) and we did not exceed Heroku usage limits. Our account manager was friendly but was unfortunately unable to provide us with any information. It is my opinion that by not warning us first (ex. "please remove X which violates Heroku's acceptable use policy") that Heroku actually violated their own terms of service.

We immediately downloaded all of the Ruqqus data, and began working on setting up shop at another host.

I'd like to give a massive shoutout to @p2hang for lending his considerable expertise in support of getting Ruqqus operational as quickly as possible. He is the third recipient of the super-rare Fire Extinguisher badge.

All (or at least, almost all) functionality is restored. There are a few things which aren't quite yet back to normal, which I hope to fix over the course of tonight and tomorrow.

Known issues:

  • hCaptcha verification issues on attempted signups

  • Custom guild colors are currently disabled. This was an intentional decision by me, as there were issues loading the style files needed for custom coloring, so it was easier to just disable that for the sake of getting up and running.

  • Notification bell stuck on.

  • Lastly, and most importantly, we have no idea how well the current server will be able to handle user load. For that reason, I will be continuing to monitor and make adjustments as needed. Performance may be spotty and unreliable as load resumes.~~ ~~Doesn't seem to be an issue, but we'll have to see how it goes with everyone trying to get on. There are some load/efficiency problems that I'm trying to sort out.

  • hCaptcha on signup is malfunctioning.

  • i.ruqqus.com image uploads don't save.

  • The most recent 30k or so comments didn't make it into the new host. Also possibly some post votes. I think all the comment votes made it in. The missing data is something I'm still working on, but you will probably see rep fluctuating unpredictably as vanished stuff is no longer counted.

If you'd like to contribute to the future of freedom, please consider donating via Patreon or Paypal to help cover current and future server costs. Cryptocurrency is also accepted.
post.title: You can't cancel freedom that easily.

body:
> On the opposite side, C++ programmers tend to be pretty honest about the language's flaws.

That's not necessarily true. I've seen a lot of people who will do some unnecessary complicated way of achieving something that's obviously best implemented procedurally and/or with raw constructs like arrays and pointers, and they'll refuse to do that *just* to avoid "C code". They act like C++ is a completely different and unrelated language to C, and that C is evil and to be avoided at all costs (There is also the flip side, C programmers who hate anything associated with C++). They end up shooting themselves in the foot wasting time creating some insane mechanism to do a task that's very simple to achieve with C-like methods, and then they get slow programs as a result. There are also those who insist on using OOP structures for *everything* no matter what, though they're usually not as bad as in some other languages (and this too has a flip side, where some people refuse to use *any* kind of OOP whatsoever).

parent.body:
Rust, Haskell, Lisp. All languages with big usability issues that the community pretends don't exist.
On the opposite side, C++ programmers tend to be pretty honest about the language's flaws. So are D programmers -- they are also well aware of C++'s flaws which is why they fixed it. :)
